Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: Patient reports feeling anxious but is managing overall, with some good days and moments of feeling overwhelmed due to crowded places and heavy to-do lists.
History of Present Illness (HPI): Patient experiences overwhelming moments triggered by certain situations and is attempting to practice deep breathing as a coping strategy.
Psychosocial History: Patient expresses a desire to help others through sex education but feels uncertain about committing due to fears of inadequacy and failure. They are also working on improving communication in their relationship with their boyfriend.
Risk Assessment: Patient acknowledges feelings of self-doubt regarding their goals and recognizes the importance of self-kindness in overcoming these feelings.
Mental Health Observations: Patient demonstrates relaxation during mindfulness practice, indicating a positive response to coping strategies.
Progress Evaluation: Patient feels positive about their mindfulness practice and the progress made towards their goals.
Therapeutic Interventions: Patient is encouraged to integrate mindfulness practices into their daily routine and to take small steps towards their goals.
Next Steps: Patient plans to practice mindfulness daily and aims to explore workshops or volunteering opportunities within the next month.
